name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name to use for the MQTT Component.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

retain.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: If all MQTT state messages should be retained. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

discovery.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Manually enable/disable discovery for a component. Defaults to the global default.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

state_topic.markdownDescription:
**string**: The topic to publish state updates to. Defaults to `<TOPIC_PREFIX>/<COMPONENT_TYPE>/<COMPONENT_NAME>/state`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

availability.markdownDescription:
Manually set what should be sent to Home Assistant for showing entity availability. Default derived from [global birth/last will message](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-last-will-birth).



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

command_topic.markdownDescription:
**string**: The topic to subscribe to for commands from the remote. Defaults to `<TOPIC_PREFIX>/<COMPONENT_TYPE>/<COMPONENT_NAME>/command`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

CONFIG.MQTT_COMMAND_COMPONENT_SCHEMA.markdownDescription:
All components in ESPHome that do some sort of communication through MQTT can have some overrides for specific options.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

transmitter_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The remote transmitter to send the remote code with. Defaults to the first one defined in the configuration.



*See also: [Remote Transmitter Actions](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-actions)*

repeat.markdownDescription:
Optionally set the code to be repeated a number of times. Defaults to sending the code only once.
  * **times** (int): The number of times to repeat the code.
  
  * **wait_time** ([Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): The time to wait between repeats.
  
  



*See also: [Remote Transmitter Actions](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-actions)*

delay.markdownDescription:
This action delays the execution of the next action in the action list by a specified time period.

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#delay-action)*

condition.markdownDescription:
**[All Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition)**: The condition to check which branch to take. See [Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

then.markdownDescription:
**[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: The action to perform if the condition evaluates to true. Defaults to doing nothing.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

else.markdownDescription:
**[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: The action to perform if the condition evaluates to false. Defaults to doing nothing.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

if.markdownDescription:
This action first evaluated a certain condition (`if:`) and then either executes the `then:` branch or the `else:` branch depending on the output of the condition.

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

condition.markdownDescription:
The condition to check whether to execute. See [Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

then.markdownDescription:
**[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: The action to perform until the condition evaluates to false.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

while.markdownDescription:
This action is similar to the [if](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action) Action. The `while` action executes a block until a given condition evaluates to false.

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

wait_until.markdownDescription:
This action allows your automations to wait until a condition evaluates to true. (So this is just a shorthand way of writing a `while` action with an empty `then` block.)

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#wait-until-action)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
This action executes an arbitrary piece of C++ code (see [Lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)).

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#lambda-action)*

component.update.markdownDescription:

uart.write.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a defined UART signal to the given UART bus.

*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#uart-write-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

light.toggle.markdownDescription:
This action toggles a light with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), boolean**: Change the ON/OFF state of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

light.control.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) is a generic call to change the state of a light - it is essentially just a combination of the turn_on and turn_off calls.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

flash_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: If set, will flash the given color for this period of time and then go back to the previous state.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

effect.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: If set, will attempt to start an effect with the given name.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

brightness.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The brightness of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. This is a master brightness that applies to all channels (both color and white) of the light. Defaults to not changing brightness.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

color_brightness.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The brightness of the color lights. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Useful to control brightness of colored and white lights separately for RGBW lights. Defaults to not changing brightness.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

red.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The red channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing red channel.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

green.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The green channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing green channel.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

blue.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The blue channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing blue channel.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

white.markdownDescription:
**percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The brightness of the white lights. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing white channel.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The white color temperature value (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) for CWWW / RGBWW lights. Defaults to not changing the color temperature value.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

light.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This action turns a light with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

light.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This action turns a light with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the light.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

relative_brightness.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage**: The relative brightness to dim the light by.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The length of the transition.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

light.dim_relative.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to dim a light that supports brightness by a relative amount.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the addressable light to control.



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

range_from.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), int**: The beginning of the range of LEDs to control. 0-based indexing. Defaults to 0 (the beginning of the strip).



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

range_to.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), int**: The end of the range of LEDs to control - this is a half-open interval. 0-based indexing. Defaults to the end of the strip (`num_leds`).



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

light.addressable_set.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually set a range of LEDs on an addressable light to a specific color.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

homeassistant.service.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can create Home Assistant service calls straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [Native API Component](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-service-action)*

homeassistant.event.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can create events in the Home Assistant event bus straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [Native API Component](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-event-action)*

homeassistant.tag_scanned.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can push tag_scanned to Home Assistant straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [Native API Component](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-tag-scanned-action)*

canbus_id.markdownDescription:
Optionally set the can bus id to use for transmitting the frame. Not needed if you are using only 1 can bus.



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

can_id.markdownDescription:
**int**: Allows to override the can id configured in the can bus device.



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

use_extended_id.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: default *false* identifies the type of *can_id*: *false*: Standard 11 Bit IDs, *true*: Extended 29Bit ID



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
**binary data**: Data to transmit, up to 8 bytes or characters are supported by can bus per frame.



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

canbus.send.markdownDescription:
The can bus can transmit frames by means of the `canbus.send` action. There are several forms to use it:

*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

climate.control.markdownDescription:
This is an [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) for setting parameters for climate devices.

*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

cover.open.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) opens the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-open-action)*

cover.close.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) closes the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-close-action)*

cover.stop.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) stops the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-stop-action)*

cover.control.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) is a more generic version of the other cover actions and allows all cover attributes to be set.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

deep_sleep.enter.markdownDescription:
This action makes the given deep sleep component enter deep sleep immediately.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

deep_sleep.prevent.markdownDescription:
This action prevents the given deep sleep component from entering deep sleep. Useful for keeping the ESP active during data transfer or OTA updating (See note below for more information).

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-prevent-action)*

dfplayer.play_next.markdownDescription:
Starts playback of next track or skips to the next track.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-next-action)*

dfplayer.play_previous.markdownDescription:
Plays the previously played track.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-previous-action)*

dfplayer.play_folder.markdownDescription:
Plays files inside numbered folders, folders must be numbered from 1 and with leading zeros. Like `01`, `02`, … etc. Files inside the folders must be numbered with two leading zeros, like `001.mp3`, `002.mp3`, … etc. Folder numbers can range from 1 to 99 and file name from 1 to 255 or folder number from 1 to 10 and file number from 1 to 1000.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-folder-action)*

dfplayer.set_device.markdownDescription:
Changes the device in use. Valid values are `TF_CARD` and `USB`.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-set-device-action)*

dfplayer.sleep.markdownDescription:
Enters sleep mode. Playback is stopped and the action `dfplayer.set_device: TF_CARD` should be send for playback to be enabled again.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-sleep-action)*

dfplayer.start.markdownDescription:
Starts playing a track or resumes paused playback.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-start-action)*

dfplayer.pause.markdownDescription:
Pauses playback, playback can be resumed from the same position with `dfplayer.start`.

*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-pause-action)*

output.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This action turns the output with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-on-action)*

output.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This action turns the output with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-off-action)*

output.set_level.markdownDescription:
This action sets the float output to the given level when executed. Note: This only works with floating point outputs like ESP8266 PWM or LEDC.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-set-level-action)*

fan.toggle.markdownDescription:
Toggles the ON/OFF state of the fan with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-toggle-action)*

fan.turn_off.markdownDescription:
Turns the fan with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-turn-off-action)*

fan.turn_on.markdownDescription:
Turns the fan with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-turn-on-action)*

fingerprint_grow.enroll.markdownDescription:
Starts the fingerprint enrollment process on the slot number defined.

*See also: [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-enroll-action)*

fingerprint_grow.cancel_enroll.markdownDescription:
Cancels the current fingerprint enrollment process. Triggers the `on_enrollment_failed` trigger.

*See also: [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-cancel-enroll-action)*

fingerprint_grow.delete.markdownDescription:
Removes the enrolled fingerprint from the slot number defined.

*See also: [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-delete-action)*

fingerprint_grow.led_control.markdownDescription:
Turns on or off the LED on the reader. Only available on select models. If you have the R503 use [fingerprint_grow.aura_led_control Action](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-aura-led-control) instead.

*See also: [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-led-control-action)*

fingerprint_grow.aura_led_control.markdownDescription:
Controls the Aura LED on the reader. Only available on select models.

*See also: [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-aura-led-control-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id) of the global variable to set.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

value.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The value to set the global variable to.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

globals.set.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to change the value of a [global](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-globals) variable without having to go through the lambda syntax.

*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

body.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: A HTTP body string to send with request.



*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

json.markdownDescription:
**mapping**: A HTTP body in JSON format. Values are [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable). See [Examples](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-examples).



*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

http_request.post.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a POST request.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

headers.markdownDescription:
**mapping**: Map of HTTP headers. Values are [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable).



*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

verify_ssl.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Verify the SSL certificate of the endpoint. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

on_response.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the request is finished.



*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

http_request.get.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a GET request.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the number to set.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action)*

value.markdownDescription:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The value to set the number to.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action)*

number.set.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template number from elsewhere in your YAML file with the [number.set Action](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action).

*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#number-set-action)*

rf_bridge.send_code.markdownDescription:
Send an RF code using this action in automations.

*See also: [on_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-code-action)*

rf_bridge.learn.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to learn new protocol timings using this action in automations. A new code with timings will be returned to [on_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-on-code-received)

*See also: [on_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-learn-action)*

rf_bridge.start_advanced_sniffing.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to listen for the advanced/extra protocols defined in the portisch firmware. The decoded codes with length and protocol will be returned to [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-on-advanced-code-received)

*See also: [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-start-advanced-sniffing-action)*

rf_bridge.stop_advanced_sniffing.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to stop listening for the advanced/extra protocols defined in the portisch firmware.

*See also: [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-stop-advanced-sniffing-action)*

rf_bridge.start_bucket_sniffing.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to dump raw sniffing data. Useful for getting codes for unsupported protocols. The raw data will be available in the log and can later be used with [rf_bridge.send_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-raw-action) action.

*See also: [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-start-bucket-sniffing-action)*

rf_bridge.send_advanced_code.markdownDescription:
Send an  RF code using this action in automations.

*See also: [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-advanced-code-action)*

rf_bridge.send_raw.markdownDescription:
Send a raw command to the onboard EFM8BB1 chip. You can see a list of available commands and format in the [Portisch Wiki](https://github.com/Portisch/RF-Bridge-EFM8BB1/wiki/Commands)

*See also: [on_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-raw-action)*

rf_bridge.beep.markdownDescription:
Activate the internal buzzer to make a beep.

*See also: [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-beep-action)*

servo.write.markdownDescription:
To use your servo motor in [automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) or templates, you can use this action to set the target level of the servo from -100% to 100%.

*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-write-action)*

servo.detach.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to disable the output on a servo motor - this will make the servo motor stop immediately and disable its active control.

*See also: [Servo Component](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-detach-action)*

sim800l.send_sms.markdownDescription:
Send a SMS message to a phone recipient using this action in automations.

*See also: [on_sms_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/sim800l.html#sim800l-send-sms-action)*

sim800l.dial.markdownDescription:
Dial to a phone recipient using this action in automations.

*See also: [on_sms_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/sim800l.html#sim800l-dial-action)*

stepper.set_target.markdownDescription:
To use your stepper motor in [automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) or templates, you can use this action to set the target position (in steps). The stepper will always run towards the target position and stop once it has reached the target.

*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-target-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the stepper.



*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

position.markdownDescription:
**int, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The position to report in steps.



*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

stepper.report_position.markdownDescription:
All steppers start out with a target and current position of `0` on boot. However, if you for example want to home a stepper motor, it can be useful to **report** the stepper where it is currently at.

*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the stepper.



*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-speed-action)*

speed.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float**: The speed in `steps/s` (steps per seconds) to drive the stepper at.



*See also: [ULN2003 Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-speed-action)*

stepper.set_speed.markdownDescription:

invert.markdownDescription:
Simple filter that just inverts every value from the binary sensor.

*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#invert)*

delayed_on_off.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Only send an ON or OFF value if the binary sensor has stayed in the same state for at least the specified time period. **Useful for debouncing binary switches**.

*See also: [delayed_off](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#delayed-on-off)*

delayed_on.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: When a signal ON is received, wait for the specified time period until publishing an ON state. If an OFF value is received while waiting, the ON action is discarded. Or in other words: Only send an ON value if the binary sensor has stayed ON for at least the specified time period. **Useful for debouncing push buttons**.

*See also: [invert](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#delayed-on)*

delayed_off.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: When a signal OFF is received, wait for the specified time period until publishing an OFF state. If an ON value is received while waiting, the OFF action is discarded. Or in other words: Only send an OFF value if the binary sensor has stayed OFF for at least the specified time period. **Useful for debouncing push buttons**.

*See also: [delayed_on](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#delayed-off)*

delay.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Delay to proceed to the next timing. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [autorepeat](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#autorepeat)*

time_off.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Interval to hold the output at OFF. Defaults to `100ms`.



*See also: [autorepeat](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#autorepeat)*

time_on.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Interval to hold the output at ON. Defaults to `900ms`.



*See also: [autorepeat](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#autorepeat)*

autorepeat.markdownDescription:
A filter implementing the autorepeat behavior. The filter is parametrized by a list of timing descriptions. When a signal ON is received it is passed to the output and the first `delay` is started. When this interval expires the output is turned OFF and toggles using the `time_off` and `time_on` durations for the OFF and ON state respectively. At the same time the `delay` of the second timing description is started and the process is repeated until the list is exhausted, in which case the timing of the last description remains in use. Receiving an OFF signal stops the whole process and immediately outputs OFF.

*See also: [delayed_on_off](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#autorepeat)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
Specify any [lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda) for more complex filters. The input value from the binary sensor is `x` and you can return `true` for ON, `false` for OFF, and `{}` to stop the filter chain.

*See also: [autorepeat](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#lambda)*

panasonic.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded Panasonic remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.

offset.markdownDescription:
Adds a constant value to each sensor value.

*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#offset)*

multiply.markdownDescription:
Multiplies each value by a constant value.

*See also: [offset](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#multiply)*

filter_out.markdownDescription:
**number**: Filter out specific values to be displayed. For example to filter out the value `85.0`

*See also: [calibrate_polynomial](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#filter-out)*

window_size.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of values over which to calculate the median when pushing out a value. This number should be odd if you want an actual received value pushed out. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [median](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#median)*

send_every.markdownDescription:
**integer**: How often a sensor value should be pushed out. For example, in above configuration the median is calculated after every 4th received sensor value, over the last 7 received values. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [median](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#median)*

send_first_at.markdownDescription:
**integer**: By default, the very first raw value on boot is immediately published. With this parameter you can specify when the very first value is to be sent. Must be smaller than or equal to `send_every` Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [median](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#median)*

median.markdownDescription:
A [simple moving median](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Median_filter#Worked_1D_example) over the last few values. This can be used to filter outliers from the received sensor data. A large window size will make the filter slow to react to input changes.

*See also: [filter_out](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#median)*

window_size.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of values over which to calculate the min/max when pushing out a value. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [min](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#min)*

send_every.markdownDescription:
**integer**: How often a sensor value should be pushed out. For example, in above configuration the min is calculated after every 4th received sensor value, over the last 7 received values. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [min](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#min)*

send_first_at.markdownDescription:
**integer**: By default, the very first raw value on boot is immediately published. With this parameter you can specify when the very first value is to be sent. Must be smaller than or equal to `send_every` Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [min](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#min)*

min.markdownDescription:
A moving minimum over the last few values. A large window size will make the filter slow to react to input changes.

*See also: [median](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#min)*

window_size.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of values over which to calculate the min/max when pushing out a value. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [max](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#max)*

send_every.markdownDescription:
**integer**: How often a sensor value should be pushed out. For example, in above configuration the min is calculated after every 4th received sensor value, over the last 7 received values. Defaults to `5`.



*See also: [max](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#max)*

send_first_at.markdownDescription:
**integer**: By default, the very first raw value on boot is immediately published. With this parameter you can specify when the very first value is to be sent. Must be smaller than or equal to `send_every` Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [max](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#max)*

max.markdownDescription:
A moving maximum over the last few values. A large window size will make the filter slow to react to input changes.

*See also: [min](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#max)*

window_size.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of values over which to perform an average when pushing out a value.



*See also: [sliding_window_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sliding-window-moving-average)*

send_every.markdownDescription:
**integer**: How often a sensor value should be pushed out. For example, in above configuration the weighted average is only pushed out on every 15th received sensor value.



*See also: [sliding_window_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sliding-window-moving-average)*

send_first_at.markdownDescription:
**integer**: By default, the very first raw value on boot is immediately published. With this parameter you can specify when the very first value is to be sent. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [sliding_window_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sliding-window-moving-average)*

sliding_window_moving_average.markdownDescription:
A [simple moving average](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average#Simple_moving_average) over the last few values. It can be used to have a short update interval on the sensor but only push out an average on a specific interval (thus increasing resolution).

*See also: [max](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sliding-window-moving-average)*

alpha.markdownDescription:
**float**: The forget factor/alpha value of the filter. Defaults to `0.1`.



*See also: [exponential_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#exponential-moving-average)*

send_every.markdownDescription:
**integer**: How often a sensor value should be pushed out. Defaults to `15`.



*See also: [exponential_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#exponential-moving-average)*

exponential_moving_average.markdownDescription:
A simple [exponential moving average](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average#Exponential_moving_average) over the last few values. It can be used to have a short update interval on the sensor but only push out an average on a specific interval (thus increasing resolution).

*See also: [sliding_window_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#exponential-moving-average)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
Perform a simple mathematical operation over the sensor values. The input value is `x` and the result of the lambda is used as the output (use `return`).

*See also: [or](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#lambda)*

delta.markdownDescription:
This filter stores the last value passed through this filter and only passes incoming values through if the absolute difference is greater than the configured value. For example if a value of 1.0 first comes in, it’s passed on. If the delta filter is configured with a value of 5, it will now not pass on an incoming value of 2.0, only values that are at least 6.0 big or -4.0.

*See also: [debounce](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#delta)*

or.markdownDescription:
Pass forward a value with the first child filter that returns. Above example will only pass forward values that are *either* at least 1s old or are if the absolute difference is at least 5.0.

*See also: [delta](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#or)*

throttle.markdownDescription:
Throttle the incoming values. When this filter gets an incoming value, it checks if the last incoming value is at least `specified time period` old. If it is not older than the configured value, the value is not passed forward.

*See also: [exponential_moving_average](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#throttle)*

heartbeat.markdownDescription:
Send the last value that this sensor in the specified time interval. So a value of `10s` will cause the filter to output values every 10s regardless of the input values.

*See also: [throttle](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#heartbeat)*

debounce.markdownDescription:
Only send values if the last incoming value is at least `specified time period` old. For example if two values come in at almost the same time, this filter will only output the last value and only after the specified time period has passed without any new incoming values.

*See also: [heartbeat](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#debounce)*

calibrate_linear.markdownDescription:
Calibrate your sensor values by using values you measured with an accurate “truth” source.

*See also: [multiply](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#calibrate-linear)*

calibrate_polynomial.markdownDescription:
Calibrate your sensor values by fitting them to a polynomial functions. This is similar to the `calibrate_linear` filter, but also allows for higher-order functions like quadratic polynomials.

*See also: [calibrate_linear](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#calibrate-polynomial)*

priority.markdownDescription:
**float**: The priority to execute your custom initialization code. A higher value means a high priority and thus also your code being executed earlier. Please note this is an ESPHome-internal value and any change will not be marked as a breaking change. Defaults to `-10`. Priorities (you can use any value between them too):
  * `800.0`: This is where all hardware initialization of vital components is executed. For example setting switches to their initial state.
  
  * `600.0`: This is where most sensors are set up.
  
  * `250.0`: At this priority, WiFi is initialized.
  
  * `200.0`: Network connections like MQTT/native API are set up at this priority.
  
  * `-100.0`: At this priority, pretty much everything should already be initialized.
  
  



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#on-boot)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: Name of the project



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

version.markdownDescription:
**string**: Version of the project



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: This is the name of the node. It should always be unique in your ESPHome network. May only contain lowercase characters, digits and hyphens. See [Changing ESPHome Node Name](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-changing-node-name).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

platform.markdownDescription:
**string**: The platform your board is on, either `ESP32` or `ESP8266`. See [arduino_version](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-arduino-version).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

board.markdownDescription:
**string**: The board ESPHome should specify for PlatformIO. For the ESP32, choose the appropriate one from [this list](http://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/platforms/espressif32.html#boards) and use [this list](http://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/platforms/espressif8266.html#boards) for ESP8266-based boards. *This only affects pin aliases and some internal settings*, if unsure choose the generic board option!



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

comment.markdownDescription:
**string**: Additional text information about this node. Only for display in UI.



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

arduino_version.markdownDescription:
The version of the Arduino framework to link the project against. See [arduino_version](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-arduino-version).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

build_path.markdownDescription:
**string**: Customize where ESPHome will store the build files for your node. By default, ESPHome puts all PlatformIO project files under a folder `<NODE_NAME>/`, but you can customize this behavior using this option.



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

platformio_options.markdownDescription:
**mapping**: Additional options to pass over to PlatformIO in the platformio.ini file. See [platformio_options](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-platformio-options).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

esp8266_restore_from_flash.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether to save & restore data from flash on ESP8266s. Defaults to `no`. See [esp8266_restore_from_flash](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-esp8266-restore-from-flash) for more info



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_boot.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the node starts. See [on_boot](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-boot).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_shutdown.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform right before the node shuts down. See [on_shutdown](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-shutdown).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_loop.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform on each `loop()` iteration. See [on_loop](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-loop).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

includes.markdownDescription:
**list of files**: A list of C[++] files to include in the main (auto-generated) sketch file for custom components. The paths in this list are relative to the directory where the YAML configuration file is in. Should have file extension `.h` - See [includes](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-includes) for more info.



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

libraries.markdownDescription:
**list of libraries**: A list of [platformio libraries](https://platformio.org/lib) to include in the project. See [platformio lib install](https://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/userguide/lib/cmd_install.html).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

name_add_mac_suffix.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Appends the last 6 bytes of the mac address of the device to the name in the form `<name>-aabbcc`. Defaults to `false`. See [Adding the MAC address as a suffix to the device name](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-mac-suffix).



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

project.markdownDescription:
ESPHome Creator’s Project information. See [Project information](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-creators-project).
  * **name** (**Required**, string): Name of the project
  
  * **version** (**Required**, string): Version of the project
  
  



*See also: [ESPHome Core Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

min_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The minimum duration the click should last. Defaults to `50ms`.



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-click)*

max_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The maximum duration the click should last. Defaults to `350ms`.



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-click)*

min_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The minimum duration the click should last. Defaults to `50ms`.



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-double-click)*

max_length.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The maximum duration the click should last. Defaults to `350ms`.



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-double-click)*

timing.markdownDescription:
The timing of the multi click. This uses a language-based grammar using these styles:
  * `<ON/OFF> for <TIME> to <TIME>`
  
  * `<ON/OFF> for at least <TIME>`
  
  * `<ON/OFF> for at most <TIME>`
  
  



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-multi-click)*

invalid_cooldown.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: If a multi click is started, but the timing set in `timing` does not match, a “cool down” period will be activated during which no timing will be matched. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [lambda](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-multi-click)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

device_class.markdownDescription:

filters.markdownDescription:

on_press.markdownDescription:

*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_release.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the button is released. See [on_release](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-release).



*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_click.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the button is held down for a specified period of time. See [on_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-click).



*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_double_click.markdownDescription:

on_multi_click.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the button is pressed in a specific sequence. See [on_multi_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-multi-click).



*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_state.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a state is published. See [on_state](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-state).

internal.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Mark this component as internal. Internal components will not be exposed to the frontend (like Home Assistant). Only specifying an `id` without a `name` will implicitly set this to true.



*See also: [Binary Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the binary sensor.



*See also: [Status Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/status.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

can_id.markdownDescription:
**integer**: default *can id* used for transmitting frames.



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

bit_rate.markdownDescription:
**enum**: One of the supported bitrates. Defaults to `125KBPS`.
  * 5KBPS
  
  * 10KBPS
  
  * 20KBPS
  
  * 31K25BPS
  
  * 33KBPS
  
  * 40KBPS
  
  * 50KBPS
  
  * 80KBPS
  
  * 83K3BPS
  
  * 95KBPS
  
  * 100KBPS
  
  * 125KBPS
  
  * 200KBPS
  
  * 250KBPS
  
  * 500KBPS
  
  * 1000KBPS
  
  



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

use_extended_id.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: default *false* identifies the type of *can_id*: *false*: Standard 11 bits IDs, *true*: Extended 29 bits ID



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

on_frame.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when ability CAN Frame is received. See [on_frame](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-on-frame).



*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the climate device to control.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

mode.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Put the climate device in a specific mode. One of
  * `OFF` - The device is manually set to off, the device is inactive.
  
  * `AUTO` - The device is should adjust the temperature dynamically. For example based on a schedule, or learned behavior.
  
  * `HEAT` - The device is set to heat to reach a target temperature.
  
  * `COOL` - The device is set to cool to reach a target temperature.
  
  * `HEAT_COOL` - The device should heat/cool to maintain a target temperature.
  
  * `FAN_ONLY` - The device only has the fan enabled, no heating or cooling is taking place.
  
  * `DRY` - The device is set to dry/humidity mode.
  
  



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the target temperature of a climate device.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature_low.markdownDescription:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the lower target temperature of a climate device with a two-point target temperature.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature_high.markdownDescription:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the higher target temperature of a climate device with a two-point target temperature.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

away.markdownDescription:
**boolean, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the away mode of the climate device.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

fan_mode.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the fan mode of the climate device. One of `ON`, `OFF`, `AUTO`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH`, `MIDDLE`, `FOCUS`, `DIFFUSE`.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

custom_fan_mode.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set one of the supported custom_fan_modes of the climate device.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

preset.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the preset of the climate device. One of `ECO`, `AWAY`, `BOOST`, `COMFORT`, `HOME`, `SLEEP`, `ACTIVITY`.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

custom_preset.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set one of the supported custom_presets of the climate device.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

swing_mode.markdownDescription:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: Set the swing mode of the climate device. One of `OFF`, `BOTH`, `VERTICAL`, `HORIZONTAL`.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

min_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The minimum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

max_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The maximum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

temperature_step.markdownDescription:
**float**: The granularity with which the target temperature can be controlled.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

visual.markdownDescription:
Visual settings for the climate device - these do not affect operation and are solely for controlling how the climate device shows up in the frontend.
  * **min_temperature** (*Optional*, float): The minimum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.
  
  * **max_temperature** (*Optional*, float): The maximum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.
  
  * **temperature_step** (*Optional*, float): The granularity with which the target temperature can be controlled.
  
  



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

internal.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Mark this component as internal. Internal components will not be exposed to the frontend (like Home Assistant). Only specifying an `id` without a `name` will implicitly set this to true.



*See also: [Climate Component](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

stop.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether to stop the cover.



*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
**string**: The state to set the cover to - one of `OPEN` or `CLOSE`.



*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

position.markdownDescription:

  * `0.0` = `0%` = `CLOSED`
  
  * `1.0` = `100%` = `OPEN`
  
  



*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

tilt.markdownDescription:
**float**: The tilt position to set. In range 0% - 100%.

device_class.markdownDescription:

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#base-cover-configuration)*

internal.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Mark this component as internal. Internal components will not be exposed to the frontend (like Home Assistant). Only specifying an `id` without a `name` will implicitly set this to true.



*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#base-cover-configuration)*

oscillation_state_topic.markdownDescription:
**string**: The topic to publish fan oscillation state changes to.

oscillation_command_topic.markdownDescription:

speed_state_topic.markdownDescription:
**string**: The topic to publish fan speed state changes to.

speed_command_topic.markdownDescription:
**string**: The topic to receive speed commands on.

on_turn_on.markdownDescription:

on_turn_off.markdownDescription:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the fan is turned off. See [fan.on_turn_on / fan.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the fan.



*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

internal.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Mark this component as internal. Internal components will not be exposed to the frontend (like Home Assistant). Only specifying an `id` without a `name` will implicitly set this to true.



*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

restore_mode.markdownDescription:
Control how the light attempts to restore state on bootup. For restoring on ESP8266s, also see `esp8266_restore_from_flash` in the [esphome section](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html).
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_OFF` (Default) - Attempt to restore state and default to OFF if not possible to restore.
  
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON` - Attempt to restore state and default to ON.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_OFF` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to OFF.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_ON` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to ON.
  
  * `ALWAYS_OFF` - Always initialize the light as OFF on bootup.
  
  * `ALWAYS_ON` - Always initialize the light as ON on bootup.
  
  



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

on_turn_on.markdownDescription:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the light is turned on. See [light.on_turn_on / light.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

restore_mode.markdownDescription:
Control how the light attempts to restore state on bootup. For restoring on ESP8266s, also see `esp8266_restore_from_flash` in the [esphome section](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html).
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_OFF` (Default) - Attempt to restore state and default to OFF if not possible to restore.
  
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON` - Attempt to restore state and default to ON.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_OFF` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to OFF.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_ON` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to ON.
  
  * `ALWAYS_OFF` - Always initialize the light as OFF on bootup.
  
  * `ALWAYS_ON` - Always initialize the light as ON on bootup.
  
  



*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

*See also: [ZyAura CO2 & Temperature & Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/zyaura.html#configuration-variables)*

unit_of_measurement.markdownDescription:
**string**: Manually set the unit of measurement the sensor should advertise its values with. This does not actually do any maths (conversion between units).



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

icon.markdownDescription:
**icon**: Manually set the icon to use for the sensor in the frontend. The icon set here is ignored by Home Assistant, if a device class is already set.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

accuracy_decimals.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually set the accuracy of decimals to use when reporting values.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

device_class.markdownDescription:
**string**: The device class for the sensor. See [https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class) for a list of available options. Set to `""` to remove the default device class of a sensor.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

state_class.markdownDescription:
**string**: The state class for the sensor. See [https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/sensor/#available-state-classes](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/sensor/#available-state-classes) for a list of available options. Set to `""` to remove the default state class of a sensor.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

last_reset_type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The last reset type to use for the sensor. Currently there is no gain in overriding this string in YAML and it should be set in the platform code. Set to `""` to remove the default last reset type of a sensor.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

force_update.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: If true, this option will force the frontend (usually Home Assistant) to create a state changed event when the sensor updates even if the value stayed the same. Some applications like Grafana require this when working with Home Assistant, but beware it can significantly increase the database size. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

expire_after.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Manually set the time in which the sensor values should be marked as “expired”/“unknown”. Not providing any value means no expiry.



*See also: [Sensor Component](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

*See also: [Stepper Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*

acceleration.markdownDescription:
**float**: The acceleration in `steps/s^2` (steps per seconds squared) to use when starting to move. The default is `inf` which means infinite acceleration, so the stepper will try to drive with the full speed immediately. This value is helpful if that first motion of the motor is too jerky for what it’s moving.  If you make this a small number, it will take the motor a moment to get up  to speed.



*See also: [Stepper Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*

**float**: The same as `acceleration`, but for when the motor is decelerating shortly before reaching the set position. Defaults to `inf` (immediate deceleration).



*See also: [Stepper Component](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*
