*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_month.markdownDescription:
**string**: Specify for which days of the month the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). Range is from 1 to 31.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

months.markdownDescription:
**string**: Specify for which months of the year to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all months). The month names JAN to DEC are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (January) to 12 (December).



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_week.markdownDescription:
**string**: Specify for which days of the week to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). The names SUN to SAT are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday).



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

cron.markdownDescription:
**string**: Alternatively, you can specify a whole cron expression like `* /5 * * * *`. Please note years and some special characters like `L`, `#` are currently not supported.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

timezone.markdownDescription:
**string**: Manually tell ESPHome what time zone to use with [this format](https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/TZ-Variable.html) (warning: the format is quite complicated) or the simpler [TZ database name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) in the form <Region>/<City>. ESPHome tries to automatically infer the time zone string based on the time zone of the computer that is running ESPHome, but this might not always be accurate.



*See also: [Time](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

on_time.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: Automation to run at specific intervals using a cron-like syntax. See [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#time-on-time).



*See also: [Time](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

on_time_sync.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: Automation to run when the time source could be (re-)synchronized.. See [on_time_sync Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#time-on-time-sync).



*See also: [Time](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Specify the ID of the time for use in lambdas.



*See also: [Time](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID for this ADS1115 Hub. Use this if you want to use multiple ADS1115 hubs at once.



*See also: [ads1115 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#configuration-variables)*

continuous_mode.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Set if the ADS1115 should continuously measure voltages or only measure them when an update is called. Please enable this for the [CT Clamp Current Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ct_clamp.html) integration. Defaults to `off`.



*See also: [ads1115 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: The i²c address of the sensor. See [I²C Addresses](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#ads1115-i2c-addresses) for more information.



*See also: [ads1115 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the animation later in your display code.



*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

file.markdownDescription:
**string**: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the gif file.



*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

resize.markdownDescription:
**string**: If set, this will resize all the frames to fit inside the given dimensions `WIDTHxHEIGHT` and preserve the aspect ratio.



*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

type.markdownDescription:
Specifies how to encode each frame internally. Defaults to `BINARY`.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  * `GREYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB24`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel.
  
  



*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

dither.markdownDescription:
Specifies which dither method used to process each frame, only used in GREYSCALE and BINARY type image. Defaults to `NONE`. You can read more about it [here](https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/Image.html?highlight=Dither#PIL.Image.Image.convert) and [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dither).
  * `NONE`: Every pixel convert to its nearest color.
  
  * `FLOYDSTEINBERG`: Uses Floyd-Steinberg dither to approximate the original image luminosity levels.
  
  



*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The I²C address of the sensor. Defaults to `0x39`.



*See also: [apds9960 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [apds9960 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID to use for code generation, and for reference by dependent components.



*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

mac_address.markdownDescription:
**MAC Address**: The MAC address of the BLE device to connect to.



*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_connect.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the client connects to a device. See [on_connect](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-connect).



*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_disconnect.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the client disconnects from a device. See [on_disconnect](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-disconnect).



*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

default_target_temperature_low.markdownDescription:
**float**: The default low target temperature for the control algorithm during away mode.



*See also: [Bang Bang Climate Controller](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html#configuration-variables)*

default_target_temperature_high.markdownDescription:
**float**: The default high target temperature for the control algorithm during away mode.



*See also: [Bang Bang Climate Controller](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html#configuration-variables)*

kp.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the proportional term of the PID controller.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

ki.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the integral term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

kd.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the derivative term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

min_integral.markdownDescription:
**float**: The maximum value of the integral term multiplied by `ki` to prevent windup. Defaults to `-1`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

max_integral.markdownDescription:
**float**: The minimum value of the integral term multiplied by `ki` to prevent windup. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

red.markdownDescription:
**percentage**: The percentage of the red component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

green.markdownDescription:
**percentage**: The percentage of the green component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

blue.markdownDescription:
**percentage**: The percentage of the blue component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

white.markdownDescription:
**percentage**: The percentage of the white component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to run for instantiating the binary sensor(s).



*See also: [Generic Custom Component](https://esphome.io/custom/custom_component.html#generic-custom-component)*

components.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of components to initialize. The length here must equal the number of items in the `return` statement of the `lambda`. This is useful if you need to give an `id` to the component you created.



*See also: [Generic Custom Component](https://esphome.io/custom/custom_component.html#generic-custom-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [dallas Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/dallas.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**number**: The pin the sensor bus is connected to.



*See also: [dallas Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/dallas.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval that the sensors should be checked. Defaults to 60 seconds.



*See also: [dallas Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/dallas.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#configuration-variables)*

on_finished_playback.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when playback is finished.



*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#configuration-variables)*

uart_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the UART hub.



*See also: [DF-Player mini](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#configuration-variables)*

mac_address.markdownDescription:
**MAC Address**: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-advertise)*

**MAC Address**: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-service-data-advertise)*

service_uuid.markdownDescription:
**string**: 16 bit, 32 bit, or 128 bit BLE Service UUID.



*See also: [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-service-data-advertise)*

mac_address.markdownDescription:
**MAC Address**: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-manufacturer-data-advertise)*

manufacturer_id.markdownDescription:
**string**: 16 bit, 32 bit, or 128 bit BLE Manufacturer ID.



*See also: [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-manufacturer-data-advertise)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**pin**: The pin the external clock line is connected to.



*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**float**: The frequency of the external clock, must be either 20MHz or 10MHz. Defaults to `20MHz`.



*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

sda.markdownDescription:
**pin**: The SDA pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOD`.



*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

scl.markdownDescription:
**pin**: The SCL pin of the I²C interface. Also called `SIOC`.



*See also: [ESP32 Camera Component](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_camera.html#configuration-variables)*

static_ip.markdownDescription:
**IPv4 address**: The static IP of your node.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

gateway.markdownDescription:
**IPv4 address**: The gateway of the local network.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

subnet.markdownDescription:
**IPv4 address**: The subnet of the local network.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

dns1.markdownDescription:
**IPv4 address**: The main DNS server to use.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

dns2.markdownDescription:
**IPv4 address**: The backup DNS server to use.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

source.markdownDescription:
The location of the components you want to retrieve. See [Local](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components-local) and [Git](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components-git).
  * **type** (**Required**): Repository type. One of `local`, `git`.
  
  git options:
  * **url** (**Required**, url): HTTP git repository url. See [Git](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components-git).
  
  * **ref** (*Optional*, string): Git ref (branch or tag). If not specified the default branch is used.
  
  local options:
  * **path** (**Required**):  Path to use when using local components. See [Local](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components-local).
  
  



*See also: [External Components](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components)*

refresh.markdownDescription:
**[time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval the source will be checked. Has no effect on `local`. See [Refresh](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components-refresh). for more info. Defaults to `1day`.



*See also: [External Components](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components)*

components.markdownDescription:
**list**: The list of components to use from the external source. By default, all available components are used.



*See also: [External Components](https://esphome.io/components/external_components.html#external-components)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

sensing_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Pin connected to the reader’s finger detection signal (WAKEUP) output.



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

password.markdownDescription:
**int**: Password to use for authentication. Defaults to `0x00`.



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

new_password.markdownDescription:
**int**: Sets a new password to use for authentication. See [Setting a New Password](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-set-new-password) for more information.



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

on_finger_scan_matched.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when an enrolled fingerprint is scanned. See [on_finger_scan_matched Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-on-finger-scan-matched).



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

on_finger_scan_unmatched.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when an unknown fingerprint is scanned. See [on_finger_scan_unmatched Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-on-finger-scan-unmatched).



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

on_enrollment_scan.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a fingerprint is scanned during enrollment. See [on_enrollment_scan Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-on-enrollment-scan).



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

on_enrollment_done.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a fingerprint is enrolled. See [on_enrollment_done Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-on-enrollment-done).



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

on_enrollment_failed.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a fingerprint enrollment failed. See [on_enrollment_failed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#fingerprint-grow-on-enrollment-failed).



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

uart_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the UART hub.



*See also: [fingerprint_grow Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/fingerprint_grow.html#component-hub)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the font later in your display code.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

file.markdownDescription:
**string**: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the TrueType font file.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

glyphs.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of characters you plan to use. Only the characters you specify here will be compiled into the binary. Adjust this if you need some special characters or want to reduce the size of the binary if you don’t plan to use some glyphs. The items in the list can also be more than one character long if you for example want to use font ligatures. Defaults to `!"%()+,-_.:°0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz`.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

size.markdownDescription:
**int**: The size of the font in pt (not pixel!). If you want to use the same font in different sizes, create two font objects. Defaults to `20`.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Give the global variable an ID so that you can refer to it later in [lambdas](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The C++ type of the global variable, for example `bool` (for `true`/`false`), `int` (for integers), `float` (for decimal numbers), `int[50]` for an array of 50 integers, etc.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

initial_value.markdownDescription:
**string**: The value with which to initialize this variable if the state can not be restored or if state restoration is not enabled. This needs to be wrapped in quotes! Defaults to the C++ default value for this type (for example `0` for integers).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

restore_value.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether to try to restore the state on boot up. Be careful: on the ESP8266, you only have a total of 96 bytes available for this! Defaults to `no`. This will use storage in “RTC memory”, so it won’t survive a power-cycle unless you use the `esp8266_restore_from_flash` option to save to flash. See [esp8266_restore_from_flash](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html) for details.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

latitude.markdownDescription:
Include the Latitude as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

longitude.markdownDescription:
Include the Longitude as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

speed.markdownDescription:
Include the measured speed as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

course.markdownDescription:
Include the measured course as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

altitude.markdownDescription:
Include the measured altitude as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

satellites.markdownDescription:
Include the number of tracking satellites being used as a sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name to give the latitude sensor
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [GPS Component](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID for this I²C bus if you need multiple I²C buses.



*See also: [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

sda.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the data line of the I²C bus. Defaults to the default of your board (usually GPIO21 for ESP32 and GPIO4 for ESP8266).



*See also: [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

scl.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the clock line of the I²C bus. Defaults to the default of your board (usually GPIO22 for ESP32 and GPIO5 for ESP8266).



*See also: [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**float**: Set the frequency the I²C bus should operate on. Defaults to `50kHz`. Values are `50kHz`, `100kHz`, `200kHz`, … `800kHz`



*See also: [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

scan.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: If ESPHome should do a search of the I²C address space on startup. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the image later in your display code.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

file.markdownDescription:

type.markdownDescription:
Specifies how to encode image internally. Defaults to `BINARY`.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  * `GRAYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB24`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

dither.markdownDescription:
Specifies which dither method used to process the image, only used in GRAYSCALE and BINARY type image. Defaults to `NONE`. You can read more about it [here](https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/Image.html?highlight=Dither#PIL.Image.Image.convert) and [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dither).
  * `NONE`: Every pixel convert to its nearest color.
  
  * `FLOYDSTEINBERG`: Uses Floyd-Steinberg dither to approximate the original image luminosity levels.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

  * **panasonic**: Decode and dump Panasonic infrared codes.
  
  * **pioneer**: Decode and dump Pioneer infrared codes.
  
  * **jvc**: Decode and dump JVC infrared codes.
  
  * **samsung**: Decode and dump Samsung infrared codes.

  * **sony**: Decode and dump Sony infrared codes.
  
  * **rc_switch**: Decode and dump RCSwitch RF codes.
  
  * **rc5**: Decode and dump RC5 IR codes.

*See also: [sm16716 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this `sm2135` component. Use this if you have multiple SM2135 chains connected at the same time.



*See also: [sm2135 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#configuration-variables)*

data_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin used for MOSI.



*See also: [sm2135 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#configuration-variables)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin which SCLK is connected to.



*See also: [sm2135 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this SN74HC595 component.



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

data_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Pin connected to SN74HC595 SER input.



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Pin connected to SN74HC595 SRCLK pin



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

latch_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Pin connected to SN74HC595 RCLK pin



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

oe_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Pin connected to SN74HC595 OE pin



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

sr_count.markdownDescription:
**int**: Number of daisy-chained shift registers, up-to 4. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [SN74HC595 I/O Expander (shift register)](https://esphome.io/components/sn74hc595.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID for this SPI hub if you need multiple SPI hubs.



*See also: [SPI Bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#configuration-variables)*

clk_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin used for the clock line of the SPI bus.



*See also: [SPI Bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#configuration-variables)*

miso_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin used for the MISO line of the SPI bus.



*See also: [SPI Bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#configuration-variables)*

mosi_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin used for the MOSI line of the SPI bus.



*See also: [SPI Bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#configuration-variables)*

elevation.markdownDescription:
**float**: The elevation to cross. Defaults to 0° (horizon).



*See also: [Sun](https://esphome.io/components/sun.html#configuration-variables)*

**float**: The elevation to cross. Defaults to 0° (horizon).



*See also: [Sun](https://esphome.io/components/sun.html#configuration-variables)*

key_rows.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of keypad rows to use. This enables any number of the first 7 pins. So a value of 3 enables pins 0,1,2 to be used as the rows for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

key_columns.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of keypad columns to use. This enables any number of the last 7 pins. So a value of 4 enables pins 8,9,10,11 to be used as the columns for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

sleep_time.markdownDescription:
**int**: No key press within this time will set keypad engine to sleep.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

scan_time.markdownDescription:
**int**: Scan time per row (must be set above debounce time).



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

debounce_time.markdownDescription:
**int**: The debounce time is common to all IOs.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this SX1509 component.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

keypad.markdownDescription:
Add this to enable the keypad.
  * **key_rows** (**Required**, int): The number of keypad rows to use. This enables any number of the first 7 pins. So a value of 3 enables pins 0,1,2 to be used as the rows for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.
  
  * **key_columns** (**Required**, int): The number of keypad columns to use. This enables any number of the last 7 pins. So a value of 4 enables pins 8,9,10,11 to be used as the columns for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.
  
  * **sleep_time** (*Optional*, int): No key press within this time will set keypad engine to sleep.
  
  * **scan_time** (*Optional*, int): Scan time per row (must be set above debounce time).
  
  * **debounce_time** (*Optional*, int): The debounce time is common to all IOs.
  
  



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: The I²C address of the driver. Defaults to `0x3E`.



*See also: [SX1509 16 channel I/O Expander with LED driver and keypad engine](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this TCA9548A component.



*See also: [TCA9548A I²C Multiplexer](https://esphome.io/components/tca9548a.html#configuration-variables)*

scan.markdownDescription:
**bool**: if the channel should be scanned Defaults to `false`



*See also: [TCA9548A I²C Multiplexer](https://esphome.io/components/tca9548a.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: The I²C address of the Multiplexer. Defaults to `0x70`.



*See also: [TCA9548A I²C Multiplexer](https://esphome.io/components/tca9548a.html#configuration-variables)*

i2c_id.markdownDescription:
The I²C Bus ID



*See also: [TCA9548A I²C Multiplexer](https://esphome.io/components/tca9548a.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.



*See also: [bme680_bsec Text Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bme680_bsec.html#text-sensor)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for the IAQ accuracy sensor.



*See also: [bme680_bsec Text Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bme680_bsec.html#text-sensor)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually set the ID of this component.



*See also: [ttp229_bsf Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/ttp229.html#id1)*

sdo_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin the SDO pin is connected to.



*See also: [ttp229_bsf Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/ttp229.html#id1)*

scl_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin the SCL pin is connected to.



*See also: [ttp229_bsf Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/ttp229.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually set the ID of this sensor.



*See also: [ttp229_lsf Component](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/ttp229.html#configuration-variables)*

**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID for this UART hub if you need multiple UART hubs.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

baud_rate.markdownDescription:
**int**: The baud rate of the UART bus.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

tx_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to send data to from the ESP’s perspective.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

rx_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to receive data on from the ESP’s perspective.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

rx_buffer_size.markdownDescription:
**int**: The size of the buffer used for receiving UART messages. Increase if you use integration that needs to read big payloads from UART. Defaults to `256`.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

invert.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Invert the logic levels of the RX and TX pins. Options: `true` or `false`. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

stop_bits.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of stop bits to send. Options: 1, 2. Defaults to 1.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

data_bits.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of data bits used on the UART bus. Options: 5 to 8. Defaults to 8.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

parity.markdownDescription:
The parity used on the UART bus. Options: `NONE`, `EVEN`, `ODD`. Defaults to `NONE`.



*See also: [UART Bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

username.markdownDescription:
**string**: The username to use for authentication.



*See also: [Web Server Component](https://esphome.io/components/web_server.html#configuration-variables)*

password.markdownDescription:
**string**: The password to check for authentication.



*See also: [Web Server Component](https://esphome.io/components/web_server.html#configuration-variables)*

ssid.markdownDescription:
**string**: The SSID or WiFi network name.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

password.markdownDescription:
**string**: The password to use for authentication. Leave empty for no password.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: The channel of the network (1-14). If given, only connects to networks that are on this channel.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

bssid.markdownDescription:
**string**: The connection’s BSSID (MAC address). BSSIDs must consist of six two-digit hexadecimal values separated by colon characters (“`:`”). All letters must be in upper case.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

hidden.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether this network is hidden. Defaults to false. If you add this option you also have to specify ssid.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

priority.markdownDescription:
**float**: The priority of this network. After each time, the network with the highest priority is chosen. If the connection fails, the priority is decreased by one. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

identity.markdownDescription:
**string**: The outer identity to pass to the EAP authentication server. This is required for EAP-TLS.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

username.markdownDescription:
**string**: The username to present to the authenticating server.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

password.markdownDescription:
**string**: The password to present to the authentication server. For EAP-TLS this password may be set to decrypt to private key instead.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

certificate_authority.markdownDescription:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded certificate to use when validating the authentication server.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

certificate.markdownDescription:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded certificate to use for EAP-TLS authentication.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

key.markdownDescription:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded private key matching `certificate` for EAP-TLS authentication. Optionally encrypted with `password`.



*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

eap.markdownDescription:
WPA2_EAP Enterprise Authentication is supported on ESP32s and ESP8266s. In order to configure this feature you must use the [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-networks) style configuration. The ESP32 is known to work with PEAP, EAP-TTLS, and the certificate based EAP-TLS. These are advanced settings and you will usually need to consult your enterprise network administrator.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

wifi-networks.markdownDescription:
Starting with version 1.10.0, you can give ESPHome a number of WiFi networks to connect to. ESPHome will then attempt to connect to the one with the highest signal strength.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

ssid.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the access point to create. Leave empty to use the device name.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

password.markdownDescription:
**string**: The password for the access point. Leave empty for no password.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: The channel the AP should operate on from 1 to 14. Defaults to 1.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

manual_ip.markdownDescription:
Manually set the IP options for the AP. Same options as manual_ip for station mode.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

ap_timeout.markdownDescription:
**[time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time after which to enable the configured fallback hotspot. Defaults to `1min`.



*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Set the ID of this sensor.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

irq_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The touch detection pin. Often marked `T_IRQ` on the board. If not specified the component will use polling via SPI.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

calibration_x_min.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The raw value corresponding to the left (or top if `swap_x_y` is specified) edge of the display. See [Calibration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#xpt2046-calibration) for the process to calibrate the touch screen. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

calibration_x_max.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The raw value corresponding to the right (or bottom if `swap_x_y` is specified) edge of the display. Defaults to `4095`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

calibration_y_min.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The raw value corresponding to the top (or left if `swap_x_y` is specified) edge of the display. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

calibration_y_max.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The raw value corresponding to the bottom (or right if `swap_x_y` is specified) edge of the display. Defaults to `4095`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

dimension_x.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The dimension of the display in the horizontal direction. Usually in pixels but a percentage can be useful as well. Defaults to `100`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

dimension_y.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The dimension of the display in the vertical direction. Usually in pixels but a percentage can be useful as well. Defaults to `100`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

threshold.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The value to detect the touch or release. Defaults to `400`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

report_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to periodically report the coordinates while the touch screen is touched. Defaults to `never`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

swap_x_y.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: If true the x and y axes are swapped. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

on_state.markdownDescription:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the touch screen is pressed or released. See [on_state Action](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#xpt2046-on-state).



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The chip select pin. Often marked `T_CS` on the board.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. If `irq_pin` is specified the touch will be detected nearly instantaneously and this setting will be used only for the release detection. Defaults to `50ms`.



*See also: [xpt2046 Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/xpt2046.html#configuration-variables)*

binary_sensor.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template binary sensor from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `binary_sensor.template.publish` action.

*See also: [Template Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/template.html#binary-sensor-template-publish-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the PID Climate being reset.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-reset-integral-term-action)*

climate.pid.reset_integral_term.markdownDescription:
This action resets the integral term of the PID controller to 0. This might be necessary under certain conditions to avoid the control loop to overshoot (or undershoot) a target.

*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-reset-integral-term-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the PID Climate to start autotuning for.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

noiseband.markdownDescription:
**float**: The noiseband of the process (=sensor) variable. The value of the PID controller must be able to reach this value. Defaults to `0.25`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

positive_output.markdownDescription:
**float**: The positive output power to drive the heat output at. Defaults to `1.0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

negative_output.markdownDescription:
**float**: The positive output power to drive the cool output at. Defaults to `-1.0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

climate.pid.autotune.markdownDescription:
This action starts the autotune process of the PID controller.

*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the PID Climate to start autotuning for.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

kp.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the proportional term of the PID controller.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

ki.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the integral term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

kd.markdownDescription:
**float**: The factor for the derivative term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

climate.pid.set_control_parameters.markdownDescription:
This action sets new values for the control parameters of the PID controller. This can be used to manually tune the PID controller. Make sure to take update the values you want on the YAML file! They will reset on the next reboot.

*See also: [PID Climate](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

cover.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template cover from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `cover.template.publish` action.

*See also: [Template Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/template.html#cover-template-publish-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the PWM output to change.



*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float**: The frequency to set in hertz.



*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

output.esp8266_pwm.set_frequency.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually change the frequency of an ESP8266 PWM channel at runtime. Use cases include controlling a passive buzzer (for pitch control).

*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the LEDC output to change.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float**: The frequency to set in hertz.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

output.ledc.set_frequency.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually change the frequency of an LEDC channel at runtime. Use cases include controlling a passive buzzer (for pitch control).

*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

cs5460a.restart.markdownDescription:
This action can be used in automations to interrupt the current *computation cycle* and start a new one.  This is useful if you’re measuring multiple current/power values using a single CS5460A chip and a signal multiplexer.  As an example you can measure the power usage on up to wall sockets in a house by using one voltage transformer and 16 current transformers, each on the cable leading to the corresponding wall socket.  One side of all the current transformers connects directly to your CS5460A current input terminal (plus any filtering and protection circuitry as recommended in the datasheet), while the other side each connects to one channel of a CD74HC4067 analog multiplexer.  The multiplexer’s single signal pin then connects to the CS5460A’s second current input terminal.  Every time the CS5460A sensor publishes a new power value, an automation can switch the multiplexer to the next channel but it needs to interrupt the *computation cycle* automatically started when the previous one ended, and start a new cycle that uses current samples only from the new CD74HC4067 multiplexer channel.

*See also: [CS5460A Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/cs5460a.html#cs5460a-restart-action)*

canbus.markdownDescription:
Controller Area Network (CAN bus) is a serial bus protocol to connect individual systems and sensors as an alternative to conventional multi-wire looms. It allows automotive components to communicate on a single or dual-wire networked data bus up to 1Mbps. CAN is an International Standardization Organization (ISO) defined serial communications bus originally developed for the automotive industry to replace the complex wiring harness with a two-wire bus. The specification calls for high immunity to electrical interference and the ability to self-diagnose and repair data errors. These features have led to CAN’s popularity in a variety of industries including building automation, medical, and manufacturing.

*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#can-bus)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `thermostat` climate platform allows you to control a climate control system in much the same manner as a physical thermostat. Its operation is similar to the [bang-bang](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html) controller; a sensor measures a value (the air temperature) and the controller will try to keep this value within a range defined by the set point(s). To do this, the controller can activate devices like a heating unit and/or a cooling unit to change the value observed by the sensor. When configured for both heating and cooling, it is essentially two [bang-bang](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html) controllers in one; it differs, however, in that interaction with the thermostat component is nearly identical to that of a real thermostat.

*See also: [Thermostat Climate Controller](https://esphome.io/components/climate/thermostat.html#thermostat-climate-controller)*
