**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: The action that should be performed when the remote requests the cover to be closed.



*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#configuration-variables)*

close_duration.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The amount of time it takes the cover to close from the fully-open state.



*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#configuration-variables)*

has_built_in_endstop.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Indicates that the cover has built in end stop detectors. In this configuration the `stop_action` is not performed when the open or close time is completed and if the cover is commanded to open or close the corresponding actions will be performed without checking current state. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#configuration-variables)*

assumed_state.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether the true state of the cover is not known. This will make the Home Assistant frontend show buttons for both OPEN and CLOSE actions, instead of hiding or disabling one of them. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the cover.



*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `time_based` cover platform allows you to create covers with position control that do not have any position feedback. The state of the cover is thus always an assumed one, the current position is approximated with the time the cover has been moving in a direction.

*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#time-based-cover)*

cover.markdownDescription:
The `cover` component is a generic representation of covers in ESPHome. A cover can (currently) either be *closed* or *open* and supports three types of commands: *open*, *close* and *stop*.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

addressable_light_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the addressable light component to use as a display.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

width.markdownDescription:
**int**: The width of the LED matrix in pixels.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

height.markdownDescription:
**int**: The height of the LED matrix in pixels.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to call the lambda to update the display. Defaults to `16ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

pixel_mapper.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: A lambda that returns the integer address of the LED given the supplied the `x` and `y` pixel coordinate. By default, a left-to-right direct pixel mapper is used.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

rotation.markdownDescription:
Set the rotation of the display. Everything you draw in `lambda:` will be rotated by this option. One of `0°` (default), `90°`, `180°`, `270°`.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. `it` will be an instance of [DisplayBuffer ](https://esphome.io/api/classesphome_1_1display_1_1_display_buffer.html). See [Display Rendering Engine](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-engine) for more information.



*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `addressable_light` display platform allows to display text and graphics on an addressable light that has been arranged in a display matrix.

*See also: [Addressable Light](https://esphome.io/components/display/addressable_light.html#addressable-light)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

model.markdownDescription:
The model of the display. Options are:
  * `M5STACK`
  
  * `TFT 2.4`
  
  



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

led_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The display’s backlight pin. **Note:** Connect to a PWM-capable pin to switch/dim the display’s backlight **or** save a pin by connecting it through a 3.3K resistor to the +3V supply.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The CS pin.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

rotation.markdownDescription:
Set the rotation of the display. Everything drawn in the `lambda:` will be rotated per this option. One of `0°` (default), `90°`, `180°`, or `270°`.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. See [Display Rendering Engine](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-engine) for more information.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `5s`.



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

pages.markdownDescription:
**list**: Show pages instead of a single lambda. See [Display Pages](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-pages).



*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `ili9341` display platform allows you to use ILI9341 ([datasheet](https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/datasheets/ILI9341.pdf), [Aliexpress](https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_dTKH6Mt)) displays with ESPHome. As this is a somewhat higher resolution display and may require pins beyond the typical SPI connections, it is better suited for use with the ESP32.

*See also: [ILI9341 TFT LCD](https://esphome.io/components/display/ili9341.html#ili9341-tft-lcd)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

greyscale.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Makes the screen display 3 bit colors. Defaults to `false`



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

partial_updating.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Makes the screen update partially, which is faster, but leaves burnin. Defaults to `false`



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

full_update_every.markdownDescription:
**int**: When partial updating is enabled, forces a full screen update after chosen number of updates. Defaults to `10`



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

ckv_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The CKV pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

gmod_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The GMOD pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

gpio0_enable_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The GPIO0 Enable pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

oe_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The OE pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

powerup_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Powerup pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

sph_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The SPH pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

spv_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The SPV pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

vcom_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The VCOM pin for the Inkplate display.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

cl_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The CL pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO0.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

le_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The LE pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO2.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_0_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 0 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO4.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_1_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 1 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO5.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_2_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 2 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO18.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_3_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 3 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO19.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_4_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 4 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO23.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_5_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 5 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO25.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_6_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 6 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO26.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

display_data_7_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The Data 7 pin for the Inkplate display. Defaults to GPIO27.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. See [Display Rendering Engine](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-engine) for more information.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `5s`.



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

pages.markdownDescription:
**list**: Show pages instead of a single lambda. See [Display Pages](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-pages).



*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
All-in-one e-paper display  `Inkplate 6` Inkplate 6 is a powerful, Wi-Fi enabled ESP32 based six-inch e-paper display – recycled from a Kindle e-reader. Its main feature is simplicity. Learn more at [Inkplate’s website](https://inkplate.io/)

*See also: [Inkplate 6](https://esphome.io/components/display/inkplate6.html#inkplate-6)*

dimensions.markdownDescription:
**string**: The dimensions of the display with `COLUMNSxROWS`. If you’re not sure, power the display up and just count them.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

data_pins.markdownDescription:
**list of [Pin Schemas](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: A list of the data pins you have hooked up to the LCD. The list can either be 8 items long (when you have connected all 8 data pins), or 4 items long (if you’re operating in 4-bit mode with either the first 4 data pins connected or the last 4 data pins connected).



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

enable_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have `EN` hooked up to.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

rs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have `RS` hooked up to.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

rw_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Optionally set the pin you have `RW` hooked up to. You can also just permanently connect that pin to GND.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. See [Rendering Lambda](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#display-lcd-lambda) for more information.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [lcd_gpio Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#id1)*

dimensions.markdownDescription:
**string**: The dimensions of the display with `COLUMNSxROWS`. If you’re not sure, power the display up and just count them.



*See also: [lcd_pcf8574 Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [lcd_pcf8574 Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: The [I²C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) address of the PCF8574 chip, defaults to `0x3F`.



*See also: [lcd_pcf8574 Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. See [Rendering Lambda](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#display-lcd-lambda) for more information.



*See also: [lcd_pcf8574 Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [lcd_pcf8574 Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/lcd_display.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

num_chips.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of chips you wish to use for daisy chaining. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

intensity.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The intensity with which the MAX7219 should drive the outputs. Range is from 0 (least intense) to 15 (the default).



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

reverse_enable.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: For some displays the order of the chips is reversed so you’ll see “56781234” instead of “12345678”. This option will adjust the output to compensate. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have the CS line hooked up to.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the MAX7219. See [Rendering Lambda](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#display-max7219-lambda) for more information.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

spi_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [SPI Component](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) if you want to use multiple SPI buses.



*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `max7219` display platform allows you to use MAX7219 7-segment display drivers ( [datasheet](https://datasheets.maximintegrated.com/en/ds/MAX7219-MAX7221.pdf), [hobbycomponents](https://hobbycomponents.com/displays/597-max7219-8-digit-seven-segment-display-module)) with ESPHome. Please note that this integration is *only* for 7-segment display, not matrix configurations.

*See also: [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html#max7219-7-segment-display)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

num_chips.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The number of chips you wish to use for daisy chaining. Defaults to `4`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

intensity.markdownDescription:
**integer**: The intensity with which the MAX7219 should drive the outputs. Range is from `0`, least intense to `15` the brightest. Defaults to `15`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

rotate_chip.markdownDescription:
Rotates every 8x8 chip. Valid values are `0`, `90`, `180` and `270`. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

scroll_mode.markdownDescription:
Set the scroll mode. One of `CONTINUOUS` or `STOP`. Defaults to `CONTINUOUS`
  * `CONTINUOUS`: Always scrolls and the text repeats continuously, you might need to add some separation at the end.
  
  * `STOP`: When text is over it waits the `scroll_dwell` time and scroll is set back to the start.
  
  



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

scroll_enable.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Turn scroll mode on when content does not fit. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

scroll_speed.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Set scroll speed. Defaults to `250ms`



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

scroll_delay.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Set delay time before scroll starts. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

scroll_dwell.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Sets the wait time at the end of the scroll before starting over. This is only used in mode `STOP`. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

reverse_enable.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: For some displays the order of the displays is reversed (“DCBA”). This option will reverse the display to (“ABCD”) again. Defaults to  `false`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin you have the CS line hooked up to.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the MAX7219. See [Rendering Lambda](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#display-max7219digit-lambda) for more information.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

spi_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [SPI Component](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) if you want to use multiple SPI buses.



*See also: [MAX7219 Digit Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219digit.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `max7219` display platform allows you to use MAX7219 digit with ESPHome. Please note that this integration is *only* for the digit “matrix” display, for the 7 segment display see [MAX7219 7-Segment Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/max7219.html).

**integer**: The intensity with which the TM1637 should drive the outputs. Range is from 0 (least intense) to 7 (the default).

clk_pin.markdownDescription:

lambda.markdownDescription:
