id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

model.markdownDescription:
The model of the E-Paper display. Options are:
  * `1.54in`
  
  * `1.54inv2`
  
  * `2.13in` (not tested)
  
  * `2.13in-ttgo` (T5_V2.3 tested. Also works for Wemos D1 Mini ePaper Shield 2.13 1.0.0 “LOLIN”)
  
  * `2.13in-ttgo-b73` (T5_V2.3 with B73 display tested)
  
  * `2.13in-ttgo-b1` (T5_V2.3 with B1 display tested)
  
  * `2.70in` (currently not working with the HAT Rev 2.1 version)
  
  * `2.90in`
  
  * `2.90inv2`
  
  * `2.90in-b` (B/W rendering only)
  
  * `4.20in`
  
  * `5.83in`
  
  * `7.50in`
  
  * `7.50inV2` (Can’t use with an ESP8266 as it runs out of RAM)
  
  



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

reset_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The RESET pin. Defaults to not connected. Make sure you pull this pin high (by connecting it to 3.3V with a resistor) if not connected to a GPIO pin.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

busy_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The BUSY pin. Defaults to not connected.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

full_update_every.markdownDescription:
**int**: E-Paper displays have two modes of switching to the next image: A partial update that only changes the pixels that have changed and a full update mode that first clears the entire display and then re-draws the image. The former is much quicker and nicer, but every so often a full update needs to happen because artifacts accumulate. On the `1.54in`, `1.54inv2`, `2.13in`, `2.90in` and `2.90inv2` models you have the option to switch only do a full-redraw every x-th time using this option. Defaults to `30` on the described models and a full update for all other models.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The CS pin.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

rotation.markdownDescription:
Set the rotation of the display. Everything you draw in `lambda:` will be rotated by this option. One of `0°` (default), `90°`, `180°`, `270°`.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to use for rendering the content on the display. See [Display Rendering Engine](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-engine) for more information.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `10s`, use `never` to only manually update the screen via `component.update`.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

pages.markdownDescription:
**list**: Show pages instead of a single lambda. See [Display Pages](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-pages).



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

spi_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [SPI Component](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) if you want to use multiple SPI buses.



*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `waveshare_epaper` display platform allows you to use some E-Paper displays sold by [Waveshare](https://www.waveshare.com/product/displays/e-paper.htm) with ESPHome. The 2.13” [TTGO module](https://github.com/lewisxhe/TTGO-EPaper-Series) with an ESP32 on the board is supported as well. Depending on your specific revision of the board you might need to try out the `-b73` or `-b1` version (see below). Similar modules sold by other vendors might also work but not have been tested yet. Currently only single-color E-Ink displays are implemented and of those only a few modules.

*See also: [Waveshare E-Paper Display](https://esphome.io/components/display/waveshare_epaper.html#waveshare-e-paper-display)*

display.markdownDescription:
The `display` component houses ESPHome’s powerful rendering and display engine. Fundamentally, there are these types of displays:

*See also: [Display Component](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-component)*

output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the binary output component to use for this fan.



*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

direction_output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the [output](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the direction state of the fan. Default is empty.



*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

oscillation_output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the [output](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the oscillation state of this fan. Default is empty.



*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for this fan.



*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `binary` fan platform lets you represent any binary [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) as a fan.

*See also: [Binary Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/binary.html#binary-fan)*

output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the [float output](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for this fan.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

oscillation_output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the [output](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the oscillation state of this fan. Default is empty.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

direction_output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the [output](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the direction state of the fan. Default is empty.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

speed_count.markdownDescription:
**int**: Set the number of supported discrete speed levels. The value is used to calculate the percentages for each speed. E.g. `2` means that you have 50% and 100% while `100` will allow 1% increments in the output. Defaults to `100`.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for this fan.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `speed` fan platform lets you represent any float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) as a fan that supports speed settings.

*See also: [Speed Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/speed.html#speed-fan)*

oscillation_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the oscillation switch. Probably not supported on any Tuya controllers currently, but it’s there if need be.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

speed_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the fan speed.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the fan switch.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

direction_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the direction switch. Supported by some ceiling fans.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

speed_count.markdownDescription:
**int**: Set the number of supported discrete speed levels. Defaults to `3`.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the fan.



*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `tuya` fan platform creates a variable speed fan from a tuya component.

*See also: [Tuya Fan](https://esphome.io/components/fan/tuya.html#tuya-fan)*

fan.markdownDescription:
With the `fan` domain you can create components that appear as fans in the Home Assistant frontend. A fan can be switched ON or OFF, optionally has a speed level between 1 and the maximum supported speed level of the fan, and can have an oscillate and direction output.

*See also: [Fan Component](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-component)*

output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the binary [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for this light.



*See also: [Binary Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Binary Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Binary Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light, though binary lights only support very few of them.



*See also: [Binary Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/binary.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `binary` light platform creates a simple ON/OFF-only light from a [binary output component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output).

*See also: [Binary Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/binary.html#binary-light)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: The lambda to run for instantiating the light output(s).



*See also: [Custom Light Output](https://esphome.io/components/light/custom.html#custom-light-output)*

lights.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of lights to initialize. The length here must equal the number of items in the `return` statement of the `lambda`.
  * All options from [Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#config-light).
  
  



*See also: [Custom Light Output](https://esphome.io/components/light/custom.html#custom-light-output)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
This integration can be used to create custom lights in ESPHome using the C++ (Arduino) API.

*See also: [Custom Light Output](https://esphome.io/components/light/custom.html#custom-light-output)*

cold_white.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the cold white channel.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the warm white channel.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

cold_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the cold white channel.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the warm white channel.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

constant_brightness.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: When enabled, this will keep the overall brightness of the cold and warm white channels constant by limiting the combined output to 100% of a single channel. This reduces the possible overall brightness but is necessary for some power supplies that are not able to run both channels at full brightness at once. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `cwww` light platform creates a Cold-White+Warm-White light from 2 [float output components](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) (one for each channel). The two channels will be mixed using the color temperature configuration options.

*See also: [Cold White + Warm White Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/cwww.html#cold-white-warm-white-light)*

num_leds.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of LEDs attached.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

rgb_order.markdownDescription:
**string**: The order of the RGB channels. Use this if your light doesn’t seem to map the RGB light channels correctly. For example if your light shows up green when you set a red color through the frontend. Valid values are `RGB`, `RBG`, `GRB`, `GBR`, `BRG` and `BGR`. Defaults to `RGB`.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

max_refresh_rate.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: A time interval used to limit the number of commands a light can handle per second. For example 16ms will limit the light to a refresh rate of about 60Hz. Defaults to the default value for the used chipset.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

chipset.markdownDescription:
**string**: Set a chipset to use. See [Supported Chipsets](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#fastled-clockless-chipsets) for options.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the data line of the FastLED light.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `fastled_clockless` light platform allows you to create RGB lights in ESPHome for a [number of supported chipsets](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#fastled-clockless-chipsets).

*See also: [FastLED Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#clockless)*

num_leds.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of LEDs attached.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

rgb_order.markdownDescription:
**string**: The order of the RGB channels. Use this if your light doesn’t seem to map the RGB light channels correctly. For example if your light shows up green when you set a red color through the frontend. Valid values are `RGB`, `RBG`, `GRB`, `GBR`, `BRG` and `BGR`. Defaults to `RGB`.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

max_refresh_rate.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: A time interval used to limit the number of commands a light can handle per second. For example 16ms will limit the light to a refresh rate of about 60Hz. Defaults to the default value for the used chipset.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

chipset.markdownDescription:
**string**: Set a chipset to use. See [Supported Chipsets](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#fastled-spi-chipsets) for options.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

data_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the data line of the FastLED light.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the clock line of the FastLED light.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

data_rate.markdownDescription:
**frequency**: The data rate to use for shifting data to the light. Can help if you have long cables or slow level-shifters.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#id1)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `fastled_spi` light platform allows you to create RGB lights in ESPHome for a [number of supported chipsets](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#fastled-spi-chipsets).

*See also: [Clockless](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html#spi)*

pin_a.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the first float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for this light.



*See also: [H-bridge Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/hbridge.html#configuration-variables)*

pin_b.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the second float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for this light.



*See also: [H-bridge Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/hbridge.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [H-bridge Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/hbridge.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [H-bridge Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/hbridge.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `hbridge` light platform creates a dual color brightness controlled light from two [float output component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output).

*See also: [H-bridge Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/hbridge.html#h-bridge-light)*

output.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for this light.



*See also: [Monochromatic Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/monochromatic.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Monochromatic Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/monochromatic.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [Monochromatic Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/monochromatic.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Monochromatic Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/monochromatic.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `monochromatic` light platform creates a simple brightness-only light from an [float output component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output).

*See also: [Monochromatic Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/monochromatic.html#monochromatic-light)*

type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The type of light. This is used to specify if it is an RGBW or RGB light and in which order the colors are. Defaults to `GRB`. Change this if you have lights with white value and/or the colors are in the wrong order.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

variant.markdownDescription:
**string**: The chipset variant. You can read more about these [here](https://github.com/Makuna/NeoPixelBus/wiki/NeoPixelBus-object#neopixel-led-model-specific-methods) (some of the info on that page is not entirely correct). One of these values:
  * `800KBPS` (default)
  
  * `400KBPS`
  
  * `WS2812X`
  
  * `SK6812`
  
  * `WS2813` (same as `WS2812X`)
  
  * `WS2812` (same as `800KBPS`)
  
  * `LC8812` (same as `SK6812`)
  
  



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

method.markdownDescription:
**string**: The method to transmit the data with. You can read more about these here: [ESP32](https://github.com/Makuna/NeoPixelBus/wiki/ESP32-NeoMethods), [ESP8266](https://github.com/Makuna/NeoPixelBus/wiki/ESP8266-NeoMethods)
  * `ESP8266_DMA` (default for ESP8266, only on pin GPIO3)
  
  * `ESP8266_UART0` (only on pin GPIO1)
  
  * `ESP8266_UART1` (only on pin GPIO2)
  
  * `ESP8266_ASYNC_UART0` (only on pin GPIO1)
  
  * `ESP8266_ASYNC_UART1` (only on pin GPIO2)
  
  * `ESP32_I2S_0`
  
  * `ESP32_I2S_1` (default for ESP32)
  
  * `BIT_BANG` (can flicker a bit)
  
  



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

invert.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Invert data output, for use with n-type transistor. Defaults to `no`.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the data line of the light.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the clock line of the light, for two-pin lights.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

data_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin for the data line of the light, for two-pin lights.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

num_leds.markdownDescription:
**int**: The number of LEDs attached.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `neopixelbus` light platform allows you to create RGB lights in ESPHome for an individually addressable lights like NeoPixel or WS2812.

*See also: [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html#neopixelbus-light)*

segments.markdownDescription:
**list**: The segments this light partition controls
  * **id** (**Required**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): The ID of the light this segment belongs to.
  
  * **from** (**Required**, int): The first LED to address in the segment. Counting starts with 0, so first LED is 0.
  
  * **to** (**Required**, int): The index of the last LED to address in this segment.
  
  * **reversed** (**Required**, int): Whether to reverse the LEDs in this segment.
  
  



*See also: [Light Partition](https://esphome.io/components/light/partition.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Light Partition](https://esphome.io/components/light/partition.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Light Partition](https://esphome.io/components/light/partition.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [Light Partition](https://esphome.io/components/light/partition.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `partition` light platform allows you to combine multiple addressable light segments (like [FastLED Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/fastled.html) or [Neopixelbus Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/neopixelbus.html)) into a single addressable light. This platform also allows splitting up an addressable lights into multiple segments, so that segments can be individually controlled.

*See also: [Light Partition](https://esphome.io/components/light/partition.html#light-partition)*

red.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the red channel.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

green.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the green channel.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

blue.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the blue channel.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `rgb` light platform creates an RGB light from 3 [float output components](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) (one for each color channel).

*See also: [RGB Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgb.html#rgb-light)*

red.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the red channel.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

green.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the green channel.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

blue.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the blue channel.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

white.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the white channel.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

color_interlock.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: When enabled, this will prevent white leds being on at the same time as RGB leds. See [Color Interlock](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#rgbw-color-interlock) for more information. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `rgbw` light platform creates an RGBW light from 4 [float output components](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) (one for each channel).

*See also: [RGBW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#rgbw-light)*

red.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the red channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

green.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the green channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

blue.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the blue channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

cold_white.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the cold white channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id of the float [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) to use for the warm white channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

cold_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the cold white channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the warm white channel.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

constant_brightness.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: When enabled, this will keep the overall brightness of the cold and warm white channels constant by limiting the combined output to 100% of a single channel. This reduces the possible overall brightness but is necessary for some power supplies that are not able to run both channels at full brightness at once. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

color_interlock.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: When enabled, this will prevent white leds being on at the same time as RGB leds. See [Color Interlock](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbw.html#rgbw-color-interlock) for more information. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

effects.markdownDescription:
**list**: A list of [light effects](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-effects) to use for this light.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `rgbww` light platform creates an RGBWW (cold white + warm white) light from 5 [float output components](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output) (one for each channel). The cold white and warm white channels will be mixed using the color temperature configuration options.

*See also: [RGBWW Light](https://esphome.io/components/light/rgbww.html#rgbww-light)*

dimmer_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the dimmer value.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the MCU minimum value setting.  If this is set then ESPHome will sync the **min_value** to the MCU on startup.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

switch_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the power switch.  My dimmer required this to be able to turn the light on and off.  Without this you would only be able to change the brightness and would have to toggle the light using the physical buttons.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_temperature_datapoint.markdownDescription:
**int**: The datapoint id number of the color temperature value.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value.markdownDescription:
**int, default 0**: The lowest dimmer value allowed.  My dimmer had a minimum of 25 and wouldn’t even accept anything lower, but this option is available if necessary.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

max_value.markdownDescription:
**int, default 255**: The highest dimmer value allowed.  Most dimmers have a maximum of 255, but dimmers with a maximum of 1000 can also be found. Try what works best.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

color_temperature_max_value.markdownDescription:
**int, default 255**: The highest color temperature value allowed. Some ceiling fans have a value of 100 (also for `max_value`).



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

cold_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the cold white channel.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

warm_white_color_temperature.markdownDescription:
**float**: The color temperate (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) of the warm white channel.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the light.



*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `tuya` light platform creates a simple brightness-only light from a tuya serial component.

*See also: [Tuya Dimmer](https://esphome.io/components/light/tuya.html#tuya-dimmer)*

light.markdownDescription:
The `light` domain in ESPHome lets you create lights that will automatically be shown in Home Assistant’s frontend and have many features such as RGB colors, transitions, flashing and effects.

*See also: [Light Component](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

max_value.markdownDescription:
**float**: The maximum value this number can be.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

min_value.markdownDescription:
**float**: The minimum value this number can be.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

step.markdownDescription:
**float**: The granularity with which the number can be set.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
**[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)**: Lambda to be evaluated every update interval to get the new value of the number.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

optimistic.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Whether to operate in optimistic mode - when in this mode, any command sent to the template number will immediately update the reported state. Cannot be used with `lambda`. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

set_action.markdownDescription:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: The action that should be performed when the remote (like Home Assistant’s frontend) requests to set the number value.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

initial_value.markdownDescription:
**float**: The value to set the state to on setup if not restored with `restore_value`. Cannot be used with `lambda`. Defaults to `min_value`.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

restore_value.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Saves and loads the state to RTC/Flash. Cannot be used with `lambda`. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the number.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the number. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `template` number platform allows you to create a number with templated values using [lambdas](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda).

*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#template-number)*

number.markdownDescription:
ESPHome has support for components to create a number entity. A number entity is like a sensor that can read a value from a device, but is useful when that value can be set by the user/frontend.

*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#configuration-variables)*

gate_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin used to control the Triac or Mosfet.



*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#configuration-variables)*

zero_cross_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin used to sense the AC Zero cross event, you can have several dimmers controlled with the same zero cross detector, in such case duplicate the `zero_cross_pin` config on each output.



*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#configuration-variables)*

init_with_half_cycle.markdownDescription:
**boolean**: Will send the first full half AC cycle Try to use this for dimmable LED lights, it might help turning on at low brightness levels. On Halogen lamps it might show at initial flicker. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#configuration-variables)*

method.markdownDescription:
Set the method for dimming, can be:
  * `leading pulse` (default): a short pulse to trigger a triac.
  
  * `leading`: gate pin driven high until the zero cross is detected
  
  * `trailing`: gate pin driven high from zero cross until dim period, this method is suitable for mosfet dimmers only.
  
  



*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
This component has not been fully tested yet, if you are testing this component please share your experience with the dimmer hardware and light model and configuration here [https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests/issues/278](https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests/issues/278)

*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#ac-dimmer-component)*

type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The type of output. One of `binary` and `float`.



*See also: [Custom Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/custom.html#custom-output)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
This integration can be used to create custom binary and float [outputs](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html) in ESPHome using the C++ (Arduino) API.

*See also: [Custom Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/custom.html#custom-output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [ESP32 DAC](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp32_dac.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin to use DAC on. Only GPIO25 and GPIO26 are supported.



*See also: [ESP32 DAC](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp32_dac.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The ESP32 DAC platform allows you to output analog voltages using the 8-bit digital-to-analog converter of the ESP32. Unlike the [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html), which can simulate an analog signal by using a fast switching frequency, the hardware DAC can output a *real* analog signal with no need for additional filtering.

*See also: [ESP32 DAC](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp32_dac.html#esp32-dac)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin to use PWM on.



*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**frequency**: The frequency to run the PWM with. Lower frequencies have more visual artifacts, but can represent much more colors. Defaults to `1000 Hz`.



*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The ESP8266 Software PWM platform allows you to use a software PWM on the pins GPIO0-GPIO16 on your ESP8266. Note that this is a software PWM, so there can be some flickering during periods of high WiFi activity. Hardware PWMs like the one on the ESP32 (see [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html)) are preferred.

*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#esp8266-software-pwm-output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [GPIO Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/gpio.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin to use PWM on.



*See also: [GPIO Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/gpio.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The GPIO output component is quite simple: It exposes a single GPIO pin as an output component. Note that output components are **not** switches and will not show up in Home Assistant. See [GPIO Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/gpio.html).

*See also: [GPIO Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/gpio.html#gpio-output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to use LEDC on. Can only be GPIO0-GPIO33.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
**float**: At which frequency to run the LEDC channel’s timer. Defaults to 1000Hz.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#configuration-variables)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually set the [LEDC channel](https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/api-reference/peripherals/ledc.html#configure-channel) to use. Two adjacent channels share the same timer. Defaults to an automatic selection.



*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The LEDC output component exposes a [LEDC PWM channel](https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/api-reference/peripherals/ledc.html) of the ESP32 as an output component.

*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#esp32-ledc-output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [MCP4725 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4725.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually specify the I2C address of the DAC. Defaults to `0x60`.



*See also: [MCP4725 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4725.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The MCP4725 output component allows to use [12bit external DAC](https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/mcp4725-digital-to-analog-converter-hookup-guide/all) in order to have analog output(s) on any board by using I2C. Devices default address is `0x60` and configurable alternative is `0x61`.

*See also: [MCP4725 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4725.html#mcp4725-output)*

my9231_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#my9231-component). Use this if you have multiple MY9231/MY9291 chains you want to use at the same time.



*See also: [my9231 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [my9231 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#id1)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Chose the channel of the MY9231/MY9291 chain of this output component. Channel 0 is the most close channel.



*See also: [my9231 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#id1)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The MY931/MY9291 output component exposes a MY931/MY9291 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#my9231-component) as a float output.

*See also: [my9231 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#id1)*

pca9685_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [PCA9685 hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#pca9685-component). Use this if you have multiple PCA9685s you want to use at the same time.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#id1)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Chose the channel of the PCA9685 of this output component. Must be in range from 0 to 15.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#id1)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The PCA9685 component represents a PCA9685 12-bit PWM driver ([datasheet](https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/api-reference/peripherals/ledc.html#configure-channel), [adafruit](https://www.adafruit.com/product/815)) in ESPHome. It uses [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) for communication.

*See also: [PCA9685](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#pca9685)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin to pulse.



*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

period.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The duration of each cycle. (i.e. a 10s period at 50% duty would result in the pin being turned on for 5s, then off for 5s)



*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
Similar to PWM, the Slow PWM Output platform allows you to control GPIO pins by pulsing them on/off over a longer time period. It could be used to control a heating element through a relay where a fast PWM update cycle would not be appropriate.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#slow-pwm-output)*

sm16716_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#sm16716-component). Use this if you have multiple SM16716 chains you want to use at the same time.



*See also: [sm16716 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [sm16716 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#id1)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Chose the channel of the SM16716 chain of this output component.



*See also: [sm16716 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#id1)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The SM16716 output component exposes a SM16716 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#sm16716-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm16716 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#output)*

sm2135_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#sm2135-component). Use this if you have multiple SM2135 chains you want to use at the same time.



*See also: [sm2135 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [sm2135 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#id1)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Chose the channel of the SM2135 chain of this output component.



*See also: [sm2135 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#id1)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The SM2135 output component exposes a SM2135 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#sm2135-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm2135 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#output)*

type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The type of output. One of `binary` and `float`.



*See also: [Template Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/template.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `template` output component can be used to create templated binary and float outputs in ESPHome.

*See also: [Template Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/template.html#template-output)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#id1)*

tlc59208f_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [TLC59208F chip](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#tlc59208f-component). Use this if you have multiple TLC59208Fs you want to use at the same time.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#id1)*

channel.markdownDescription:
**int**: Choose the channel of the TLC59208F for this output component. Must be in range from 0 to 7.



*See also: [PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#id1)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: The I²C address of the driver. Defaults to `0x20`.



*See also: [Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The TLC59208F component represents a Texas Instruments TLC59208F 8-bit PWM driver ([datasheet](http://www.ti.com/lit/gpn/tlc59208f), [hw example](https://faboplatform.github.io/ArduinoDocs/03.I2C%20Brick/211_brick_i2c_7seg/)) in ESPHome. It uses [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) for communication.

*See also: [TLC59208F](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#tlc59208f)*

output.markdownDescription:
Each platform of the `output` domain exposes some output to ESPHome. These are grouped into two categories: `binary` outputs (that can only be ON/OFF) and `float` outputs (like PWM, can output any rational value between 0 and 1).

*See also: [Output Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to measure the voltage on. Or on the ESP8266 alternatively also `VCC`, see [ESP8266 Measuring VCC](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#adc-esp8266-vcc).



*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#configuration-variables)*

attenuation.markdownDescription:
Only on ESP32. Specify the ADC attenuation to use. See [ESP32 Attenuation](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#adc-esp32-attenuation).



*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name of the voltage sensor.



*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The Analog To Digital (`adc`) Sensor allows you to use the built-in ADC in your device to measure a voltage on certain pins. On the ESP8266 only pin A0 (GPIO17) supports this. On the ESP32 pins GPIO32 through GPIO39 can be used.

*See also: [Analog To Digital Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/adc.html#analog-to-digital-sensor)*

irq_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin connected to the ADE7935 IRQ line (if connected)



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

voltage.markdownDescription:
Use the voltage value of the sensor in volt. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

current_a.markdownDescription:
Use the current value of the A channel in amperes. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

current_b.markdownDescription:
Use the current value of the B channel in amperes. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

active_power_a.markdownDescription:
Use the power value of the A channel in watts. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

active_power_b.markdownDescription:
Use the power value of the A channel in watts. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually specify the I²C address of the sensor. Defaults to `0x38`.



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
This page is incomplete and could some work. If you want to contribute, please read the [contributing guide](https://esphome.io/guides/contributing.html). This page is missing:

*See also: [ADE7953 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ade7953.html#ade7953-power-sensor)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

ads1115_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [ADS1115 Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#ads1115-component) you want to use this sensor.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

multiplexer.markdownDescription:
The multiplexer channel of this sensor. Effectively means between which pins you want to measure voltage.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

gain.markdownDescription:
**float**: The gain of this sensor.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for this sensor.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#id3)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `ads1115` sensor allows you to use your ADS1115 sigma-delta ADC sensors ([datasheet](http://www.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/ads1115.pdf), [Adafruit](https://www.adafruit.com/product/1085)) with ESPHome. First, setup an [ADS1115 Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#ads1115-component) for your ADS1115 sensor and then use this sensor platform to create individual sensors that will report the voltage to Home Assistant.

*See also: [ads1115 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#sensor)*

temperature.markdownDescription:
The information for the temperature sensor.
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the temperature sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [AHT10 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/aht10.html#configuration-variables)*

humidity.markdownDescription:
The information for the humidity sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the humidity sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [AHT10 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/aht10.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:

*See also: [AHT10 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/aht10.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `aht10` Temperature+Humidity sensor allows you to use your aht10 ([datasheet](http://www.aosong.com/userfiles/files/media/aht10%E8%A7%84%E6%A0%BC%E4%B9%A6v1_1%EF%BC%8820191015%EF%BC%89.pdf)) i2c-based sensor with ESPHome.

*See also: [AHT10 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/aht10.html#aht10-temperature-humidity-sensor)*

temperature.markdownDescription:
The information for the temperature sensor.
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the temperature sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [AM2320 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/am2320.html#configuration-variables)*

The information for the humidity sensor
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the humidity sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [AM2320 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/am2320.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [AM2320 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/am2320.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `am2320` Temperature+Humidity sensor allows you to use your AM2320 ([datasheet](https://akizukidenshi.com/download/ds/aosong/AM2320.pdf)) I²C-based sensor with ESPHome.

*See also: [AM2320 Temperature+Humidity Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/am2320.html#am2320-temperature-humidity-sensor)*

type.markdownDescription:
**string**: The type of sensor measurement. One of
  * **CLEAR**
  
  * **RED**
  
  * **GREEN**
  
  * **BLUE**
  
  * **PROXIMITY**
  
  



*See also: [apds9960 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#sensor)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for the sensor.



*See also: [apds9960 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#sensor)*

id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.



*See also: [apds9960 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#sensor)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `apds9960` sensor allows you to use your [APDS9960 Sensor to perform different measurements.

*See also: [apds9960 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/apds9960.html#sensor)*

distance.markdownDescription:
Distance in km to the front of the storm and not the distance to a lightning strike.
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the distance sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [as3935 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/as3935.html#sensor)*

lightning_energy.markdownDescription:
Lightning energy value. According to the datasheet this is only a pure value that doesn’t have any physical meaning.
  * **name** (**Required**, string): The name for the lightning energy sensor.
  
  * **id** (*Optional*, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Set the ID of this sensor for use in lambdas.
  
  * All other options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [as3935 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/as3935.html#sensor)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
A sensor platform to read lightning data

*See also: [as3935 Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/as3935.html#sensor)*

phase_a.markdownDescription:
The configuration options for the 1st phase.
  * **voltage** (*Optional*): Use the voltage value of this phase in V (RMS). All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **current** (*Optional*): Use the current value of this phase in amperes. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **power** (*Optional*): Use the power value on this phase in watts. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **reactive_power** (*Optional*): Use the reactive power value on this phase. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **power_factor** (*Optional*): Use the power factor value on this phase. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **gain_voltage** (*Optional*, int): Voltage gain to scale the low voltage AC power pack to household mains feed. Defaults to `7305`.
  
  * **gain_ct** (*Optional*, int): CT clamp calibration for this phase. Defaults to `27961`.
  
  * **forward_active_energy** (*Optional*): Use the forward active energy value on this phase in watt-hours. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  * **reverse_active_energy** (*Optional*): Use the reverse active energy value on this phase in watt-hours. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).
  
  



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

phase_b.markdownDescription:
The configuration options for the 2nd phase. Same options as 1st phase.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

phase_c.markdownDescription:
The configuration options for the 3rd phase. Same options as 1st phase.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
Use the frequenycy value calculated by the meter. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

chip_temperature.markdownDescription:
Use the chip temperature value. All options from [Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#config-sensor).



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

line_frequency.markdownDescription:
**string**: The AC line frequency of the supply voltage. One of `50Hz`, `60Hz`.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

current_phases.markdownDescription:
The number of phases the meter has, `2` or, `3` The 6 Channel Expandable Energy Meter should be set to `3`, and the Split Single Phase meter should be set to `2`. Defaults to `3`.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

gain_pga.markdownDescription:
**string**: The gain for the CT clamp, `2X` for 100A, `4X` for 100A - 200A. One of `1X`, `2X`, `4X`. Defaults to `2X` which is suitable for the popular SCT-013-000 clamp.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

cs_pin.markdownDescription:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin CS is connected to. For the 6 channel meter main board, this will always be 5 and 4. For the add-on boards a jumper can be selected for each CS pin, but default to 0 and 16.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

spi_id.markdownDescription:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the [SPI Component](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) if you want to use multiple SPI buses.



*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `atm90e32` sensor platform allows you to use your ATM90E32 voltage/current and power sensors ([datasheet](http://ww1.microchip.com/downloads/en/devicedoc/Atmel-46003-SE-M90E32AS-Datasheet.pdf)) with ESPHome. This sensor is commonly found in CircuitSetup 2 and 6 channel energy meters.

*See also: [ATM90E32 Power Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/atm90e32.html#atm90e32-power-sensor)*

id.markdownDescription:

*See also: [BH1750 Ambient Light Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bh1750.html#configuration-variables)*

resolution.markdownDescription:
**string**: The resolution of the sensor in lx. One of `4.0`, `1.0`, `0.5`. Defaults to `0.5` (the maximum resolution).



*See also: [BH1750 Ambient Light Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bh1750.html#configuration-variables)*

measurement_duration.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually specify the measurement duration between `31` and `254`. Defaults to `69`.



*See also: [BH1750 Ambient Light Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bh1750.html#configuration-variables)*

name.markdownDescription:
**string**: The name for the sensor.



*See also: [BH1750 Ambient Light Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bh1750.html#configuration-variables)*

address.markdownDescription:
**int**: Manually specify the I²C address of the sensor. Defaults to `0x23` (address if address pin is pulled low). If the address pin is pulled high, the address is `0x5C`.



*See also: [BH1750 Ambient Light Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/bh1750.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:

allOf.markdownDescription:

*See also: [BLE Client Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

characteristic_uuid.markdownDescription:

descriptor_uuid.markdownDescription:

ble_client_id.markdownDescription:
